name: Novotel Poznan Centrum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is currently in a bit of a time warp, The public areas are out dated (though currently being partly refurbished) and are all hard / stone surfaces and cold looking.The entrance is somewhat obtusely located, even our taxi from the airport was not aware of its location and left us off at the rear of the adjacent car park
reviews.title: Could / should be better

reviews.text: The rooms were basic but clean. The breakfast was reasonable, both in choice and quality, though service was not very attentive
reviews.title: Novotel Poznan Centrum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was booked through a third party website and even though a confirmation was received directly from the hotel, the front desk initially attempted to claim on arrival that the reservation was for one person / breakfast rather that the two that were booked and pre paid
reviews.title: A lovely trip to Poland

reviews.text: The hotel is very well located being adjacent to the major shopping center and within a reasonable walking distance of both the old town square and the exhibition center
reviews.title: great experience.....decent location

reviews.text: very big hotel, the breakfast was first class, i thought the room was too small for the money. the location is very good, close to the old town and next door to the shopping center. i would use this hotel again
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: This was my second visit to the Novotel Poznan Centrum. The hotel is well situated (at least for my business needs). It has a very big mall very near that can solve your food (and shopping) necesities.
reviews.title: Well situated and improving their common areas

reviews.text: The rooms are fine, but the wifi signal was not very good. The breakfast is a typical Novotel thing: Nothing to die for but correct food, with choice and very filling.
reviews.title: Worth considering

reviews.text: The common areas are in the middle of a - much needed - renovation. When they finish it, the hotel will have a more modern look, as now is a bit austere and somehow cheap.
reviews.title: One of the worst housekeeping experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are doing business in this area of the city, this is a good option and will be a better one in the near future. Do not count with a strong wifi signal though (at least in some rooms).
reviews.title: Location

reviews.text: The hotel is very reasonably located, next to the shoping center Stary Browar. As the weather was good, we enjoyed also the fact that the hotel is within walking distance from the Old Town. At the moment (April 2013) some construction goes inside. As far as I remember last time I stayed there, the other parts of the hotel were under renovation. So may be soon it will be a construction-free site :). The hotel garage is pretty small, but there is open-air guarded parking next to the hotel. We enjoyed both hotel restaurant, and a have wide choice of other restaurants, bars and cafeteria in Stary Browar (across the street).
reviews.title: Just what was needed

reviews.text: I spent couple of days in this hotel at the end of September. I would like to compliment the staff for their professionalism and attentiveness. Rooms are also comfortable. What is more, location is just perfect - few steps away from fabulous Old Market Square. Would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Close to everywhere, perfect service!

reviews.text: Novotel Poznan Centrum was an ideal hotel for business travel. Rooms were of a very good standard and well-equipped. Beds - as normal in the Accor hotels - were really comfy and my room had free wi-fi, a big bonus! Only drawback is its location which is not hugely central.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great price

reviews.text: very good location in the heart of Poznan,great for ladies coz close to big shopping centre,and now very confused/dissapointed with hotel itself.Great modern lobby and restaurant but rooms are very very old.Old Tv,bathrooms are really bad need some good designs and changes. In general wouldnt come back.
reviews.title: Confused

reviews.text: The hotel has very good location close to the city center. The airport is only 10-15 minutes by car and the train station is in walking distance. My hotel room was a really nice executive room with a huge and comfortable bed. The hotel and the room was also clean. The chambermaid cleaned my room every day and they kept special attention also the smallest thing. There is also a fitness room on the 1st floor with some machines to exercise. The WIFI is free also in the rooms. The staff was very helpful and polite. I was really satisfied with the restaurant and the nice F&B staff.
reviews.title: Perfect staff

reviews.text: Very average chain hotel. Huge building, old rooms, quite poor cleanliness but overall OK - good for one or two nights. Close to the railway station, Stary Browar is vis-a-vis. Nice staff, good breakfast and that's all.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: I was there a few times with my friends. The hotel is in the center, right next to famous shopping mall " Stary Browar". The train station is less than fifteen minutes walk, Old Market (Stary Rynek) is more or less the same distance. The building is quite tall so if you get a room which is on a high level you can get a nice view of Poznan. The quality of the rooms, bathrooms and service is good. Breakfast is expensive and not worth the price.
reviews.title: Hotel with a nice view

reviews.text: i stayed in Novotel Poznan Hotel for 1 night - 18/12/2012 in room 1301
reviews.title: 100% Positive

reviews.text: Hotel was just 10 minutes walk from Poznan central station, and is like 7 minutes walk to the old city !!!
reviews.title: Average hotel in Poznan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing welcome and check in process, friendly staff
reviews.title: great stay

description: The Novotel Poznan Centrum is the ideal hotel for a business trip to Poznan. Our meeting rooms for up to 800 people are perfect for conferences and seminars of all kinds. Close to the International Exhibition Centre and train station, with walking distance to the the Old Town and Stary Browar shopping mall, the hotel also offers a business lounge, WiFi internet, Executive rooms and car rental service for your convenience. After a busy day, relax and enjoy our restaurant, bar and casino.
